intro: Hieracium lepidolytes, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and basal rosette of leaves, which are typically covered in fine, glandular hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils across Europe and parts of Asia. Hieracium lepidolytes is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in open habitats.
